dialogues.text: Hello stranger, you visit us in troubling times.
If you're looking for the Forest Warden, I'm afraid I can't help you. The fog has taken him...
I sent some scouts into the forest to look for him, but they haven't returned. I fear the worst...

options.text: What do you mean 'the fog has taken him'?
When did the fog first appear?

dialogues.text: The Warden has gone missing, as have other people. I fear they might suffer the same fate as him.
A few weeks ago, the Aemir river started washing in polluted water.
I suspect that the pollution of this sacred source of water has angered the forest spirits, who summoned this fog in retaliation.
Thank you, stranger. My name is Elenthir, by the way. I'm glad you wish to help us.
I suggest you follow the Aemir river upstream and look for the origin of the river. First, look for the rocky scaffolds east of the pond.
These scaffolds will take you up the mountain slopes. After that, follow the river north. Good luck!
Hello, traveler. Have you discovered anything?
I see. And what did you find out?

options.text: A spirit named Porewit summoned the fog to protect the forest.
The river was polluted by someone, not something.
The spirit did not take the missing people.

dialogues.text: Porewit?! He is an ancient protector of these woods and was one of the first Celenor elves that settled here. If he was angered, there must be trouble.
This is dire news. If a person was responsible for this, we must find out who did this, traveler!
Interesting... So if not Porewit, then who or what is responsible for these disappearances?
You should ask people in Celewynn if they have seen anything suspicious lately. Please see me again when you have some leads.
What news have you, traveler?

options.text: A man was looking for suspicious ingredients for a potion.
A man was seen climbing the slopes, but has not returned.

dialogues.text: Those are some very strange ingredients indeed. If a magical potion was used to pollute the river, I fear this might be a targeted move... But why?
The fact that he has not yet returned suggests that he is still out there. He must still be somewhere in the Aemir Riverflank.
You should look for our suspect in the Aemir Riverflank. Try to find evidence of what happened!
Greetings, traveler. How goes your investigation?
The Halogwyr! My goodness, traveller. If this is true, then I must inform the council immediately.
What? The Warden himself was responsible for all of this? How is that possible. How come we had not noticed?
Furthermore, the missing elves have sworn allegiance to the Halogwyr? This is worrying...
If the Halogwyr are recruiting actively, I fear they are an immediate threat. Thank you for sharing this, traveler.
You did it! You managed to purify the Aemir river and get rid of the fog! Thank you, traveler! This means a great deal to us.
The Aemir pond has magical properties. You can pay homage to nature at this divine location for a temporary boost in fishing and water magic.
Feel free to use the pond whenever you like, traveler. I will also grant you access to the advanced area of our mines.
I will have to seek consult with the council for a course of action. Until then, you have our deepest appreciation, traveler.
Allow me to reward you.
{PLACEHOLDER FOR ACTION}
Hello, traveler. Thank you for restoring peace to Celewynn. We may require your help again in the future, when the council has decided.
